intro: Paronychia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Paronychia cuatrecasasii is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
